title: Madness, Rack, and Honey: Collected Lectures
description: Over the course of fifteen years, Mary Ruefle delivered a lecture every six months to a group of poetry graduate students. Collected here for the first time, these lectures include "Poetry and the Moon," "Someone Reading a Book Is a Sign of Order in the World," and "Lectures I Will Never Give." Intellectually virtuosic, instructive, and experiential, Madness, Rack, and Honey resists definition, demanding instead an utter—and utterly pleasurable—immersion.Mary Ruefle has published more than a dozen books of poetry, prose, and erasures. She lives in Vermont.
author: Mary Ruefle
